meanings.definition: More foolish or stupid than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He felt like the shmuckier student in the class.
meanings.sent2: The clown's outfit looked even shmuckier under the bright lights.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to catch its tail made it look even shmuckier.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to wear mismatched socks was the shmuckier choice.
meanings.sent5: The broken umbrella became even shmuckier in the rainstorm.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something seem more foolish or stupid.
meanings.sent1: She tried to shmuckier her brother by telling embarrassing stories.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jokes always manage to shmuckier the audience.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's plan to put fake spiders everywhere would definitely shmuckier his friends.
meanings.sent4: The magician's trick with disappearing coins seemed to shmuckier the skeptical crowd.
meanings.sent5: The fake mustache only served to shmuckier his disguise further.
